availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harvey J. Burns (Captain, 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.))

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Native of Mercer County. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Captain in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A) from August 22, 1862, to September 11, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 2, p. 601.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 2, p. 8.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 243.
